answers.author: Lawrence Di Re
answers.text:
There are many different types of public hearings conducted by all levels of government in the US (federal, state, and local).  You may find this document valuable as a guideline to federal rulemaking.  https://www.federalregister.gov/uploads/2011/01/the_rulemaking_process.pdf 
State and local agencies vary about their public hearing requirements.  These differences may include where the notice is published and for how long prior to the meeting or how long a person has to speak during the hearing.  For example you might want to research a particular department or agency.  Here's an example of one state's transportation department's public hearing rules.  Other states may be similar or different to varying degrees.  http://www.dot.state.fl.us/emo/pubs/public_involvement/Chap%208%20Public%20Hearings_Footer_v4.pdf 
Hope that helps shed some light on the public hearing process.
